alert.note: Alert for Southeast Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:12PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila County through 315 PM MST... At 212 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Young, or 26 miles northeast of Roosevelt, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Gila County. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 267 and 297. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
